law.text: It is intended that certain insurance coverages may come within the definitions of two (2) or more kinds of insurance as defined in this chapter, and the inclusion of such coverage within one (1) definition shall not exclude it as to any other kind of insurance within the definition of which such coverage is likewise reasonably includable.
law.history: Created 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 301, subtit. 5, sec. 1, effective June 18, 1970.
